conclusion: Analyze changes in shadows A, B, C, and D when light source moves to back right.
Shadow A (nail) is pointing to the left.
Shadow C (roll with cross) is pointing to the upper left.
Shadow D (ring) is pointing to the lower left.
Light source movement to back right changes direction of light, causing shadows to shift toward the front left.
Shadow A (nail) will move toward the front left.
Shadow B (cake) will shift toward the front left.
Shadow C (roll with cross) will extend more toward the front.
Shadow D (ring) will move toward the front left.
Shadows may become longer if the light angle becomes more oblique, affecting their size.
All shadows will reorient toward the front left.
Shadows might elongate depending on the new angle of the light.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift toward the front left and may increase in size if the light angle becomes more oblique.
